alert.note: Alert for Butler; Clermont; Hamilton; Warren (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 5:13PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN HAMILTON, SOUTHEASTERN BUTLER, NORTHWESTERN CLERMONT AND SOUTHERN WARREN COUNTIES THROUGH 545 PM EDT... At 511 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Olde West Chester, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, penny size hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Hamilton, Fairfield, Mason, Lebanon, Sharonville, Monroe, Blue Ash, Loveland, Springdale, Montgomery, West Chester, Morrow, Kings Island, Sixteen Mile Stand, Olde West Chester, Four Bridges, Highpoint, Wetherington, Brecon and Remington. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 16 and 28. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 16 and 27. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
